venue.name: Cambridge Center for Adult Education, Blacksmith House

item.description:
Learn how to grow your own food indoors, year-round. Sprout clover, broccoli, mustard, lentils, mung beans, and garbanzos in jars; buckwheat, sunflower, and pea shoots in shallow flats of soil; and flax on clay plates. These foods are enzyme and vitamin rich, very healthy, tasty, and easy to grow. The facilitators, nine-year adherents to a raw-food diet, will share their experience in growing sprouts and microgreens using a variety of methods. A demonstration of simple recipes will be included. Limited to 30.
Register for class with the Cambridge Center for Adult Education-phone: 617-547-6789 web: http://www.ccae.org
$30
item.how_to_find_us: register for class with Cambridge Center for Adult Ed. Call 617-492-2340 with questions
item.name: Sprouts and Microgreens: Growing and Preparing
